explains: adj. 平庸的，中等（质量）的

sentences.en: I thought the play was only mediocre.
sentences.cn: 我认为这部戏剧只是平庸之作。

sentences.en: His work rarely rises above the mediocre.
sentences.cn: 他工作平平，很少有突出的表现。

sentences.en: Virginia was a perfectionist. She was just not prepared to settle for anything mediocre.
sentences.cn: 弗吉尼娅是个完美主义者。她就是无法勉强接受任何平庸的东西。
